Articles.Content:
I've 'installed' the Karbonite mod, it all works great except I can't show hot spots.

When you right click on the "KA-100 detection Array" it just shows the abundances and gives no option to toggle the view to show hotspots, picture: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1e...ew?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1eeldqFPfcSRm5XQ21TOVNESFk/view?usp=sharing)

Extraction of Karbonite works fine, I just can't see where the richest areas are.

I've got:

KSP version = 0.90.0;

Karbonite\_0.5.1

Windows 64 bit

Thanks in advance, I'm desperate to build a mining colony.

Yes, that is default behavior. You need to install either the MapResourceOverlay to see it in map view, like Kethane does.

You may also install ScanSat along side MRO or in place of it. In this case you must send up satellites to map the moon/planet first so you can see where it is. MRO has an option to "enable ScanSat" so it only shows you what has been mapped already.

Thanks for the help ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) You need to install MRO mod to even see the hot spots via the orange spheres off the KA-100 scanner? My brother downloaded the Karbonite mod and it just worked out of the box for that view.
Karbonite (and Regolith) haven't used the orange spheres for months now.

One last question, when I added 0.2.7 MRO, it said that I needed to use KSP 0.24.2 version as the 0.2.7 wasn't compatible.

1 - Is that correct?

2 - Where can I find a KSP 0.9.0.705 compatible version?

Thanks so much guys.
